snippet: A government watchdog issued a report Wednesday harshly criticizing Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu’s handling of a raid on a Gaza-bound Turkish ship in 2010, which left nine activists dead.
abstract: Israel’s state comptroller issues a report harshly criticizing Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu over his handling of a commando raid on a Gaza-bound Turkish ship in 2010; raid, meant to halt a flotilla challenging Israel’s naval blockade of the territory, turned deadly, with severe diplomatic consequences for Israel; concludes that the decision-making process before the raid, under the leadership and responsibility of Netanyahu, was flawed.
lead_paragraph: A government watchdog issued a report Wednesday harshly criticizing Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu’s handling of a raid on a Gaza-bound Turkish ship in 2010, which left nine activists dead.

headline.seo: Israeli Watchdog Criticizes Government Over Gaza Flotilla Raid
headline.main: Israeli Watchdog Criticizes Government Over Gaza Flotilla Raid
headline.print_headline: Israel’s Official Watchdog Criticizes Gaza Flotilla Raid
